gamelogic.units
Class Unit

java.lang.Object
  gamelogic.units.Unit
Direct Known Subclasses:
AirTransport, Appros, AttackUnit, Constructor, Fuel, Genius, MineLayer, Repair, Scanner, Surveyor
public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
julien Provides a global model for a single unit. These can be building, ground, water or air units. Each unit inherits from this class and reimplements some methods.

Constructor Summary
Unit(Player p, boolean moveable)
          Creates a new unit for the given player.

Constructor Detail

Unit

public Unit(Player p,
            boolean moveable)
Creates a new unit for the given player. If moveable is set to true, the unit will be moveable (that is, not a building)

Parameters:
p - The owner of the new unit.
moveable - Set to true if the unit is moveable.
Method Detail

getOwner

public Player getOwner()
Returns the current owner of the unit.

Returns:
A reference to the owner of the unit.

setClient

public void setClient(BoardListener cl)
Sets the unique client of the unit. This client will be notified only by event on this unit.

Parameters:
cl - The client of the unit.

getClient

public BoardListener getClient()
Returns the client of the unit.

Returns:
The current client of the unit.

setPosition

public void setPosition(Square pos)
Sets the position of the unit. The board will not be notified of this action.

Parameters:
pos - The position a the unit, as a Square object.

getPosition

public Square getPosition()
Returns the position of the unit.

Returns:
The position of the unit, as a Square object.

setBoard

public void setBoard(Board b)
Sets the board associated with the unit.

Parameters:
b - The board parent of the unit.

getBoard

public Board getBoard()
Returns the board the unit belongs to.

Returns:
The board parent of the unit.

shot

public void shot(int damage)
Make the unit being shot. The unit will automatically compute its new HP and destroy itself if necessary.

Parameters:
damage - The attack factor of the unit shooting.

destroy

public void destroy()
Destroy the unit in the game. Does not destroy the object.

move

public void move(Square dest)
Moves the unit to the specified Square. If there is no way the unit can find to go to the given destination, the unit will not move. Otherwise, it will notify its board of the path taken.

Parameters:
dest - The destination of the unit.

canMove

public boolean canMove(java.util.Vector<Square> path)
Indicates whether the unit can take the path given in one turn.

Parameters:
path - The path to take.
Returns:
Whether the unit can take the path.

Computes new values for the beginning of a turn (For example, the shots, the moves...)
